officialTitle: Left Atrial Anatomy Reconstruction Using Model Based Fast Anatomical Mapping

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years
* Have AF as follows:

  1. Paroxysmal AF - defined as AF that is non-sustained (terminate without electrical or pharmacologic cardioversion) lasting \< 7 days.
  2. Persistent AF - defined as AF that is sustained \> 7 days. Episodes of AF which are terminated by electrical or pharmacologic cardioversion after ≥ 48 hours of AF, but prior to 7 days, should also be classified as persistent AF episodes.
* Are planned to undergo a first catheter ablation procedure (prior typical atrial flutter is allowed)
* Have the ability to understand the requirements of the study and sign the informed consent form.
* Are willing to adhere to study restrictions and comply with all post-procedural follow-up requirements

Exclusion Criteria:

* Rheumatic heart disease,
* Current intra-cardiac thrombus
* Class IV HF
* Unable to sign consent
* Unstable angina
* Recent cerebral ischemic events
* Contradiction to anticoagulation
* Prior cardiac surgery
* Complex congenital heart disease

primary.description:
mMap Scoring Questionnaire: Tool used by operators to rate the accuracy of the map based on the distance between ablation points and accuracy of anatomy compared to the mapped mFam geometry.

Total score from 1-7, with lower score indicating not representing (misleading) and higher score indicating agreement (accurate)
primary.timeFrame: hospital discharge, average 24 hours post procedure

secondary.description: The amount of time it takes to create the geometrical map using Carto and MFAM during the ablation procedure
secondary.timeFrame: during the procedure up to 60 minutes

secondary.description: Fluoroscopy (radiation) time for left atrial anatomy creation during the ablation procedure
secondary.timeFrame: hospital discharge, average 24 hours post procedure
